messages.content: QLoRA (Quantized Low-Rank Adaptation) is an efficient fine-tuning method that uses 4-bit quantization to reduce memory usage while maintaining performance.
Explain the main benefit of PEFT.
PEFT (Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning) allows you to adapt large pre-trained models to specific downstream tasks by training only a small number of (extra) model parameters.
TinyLlama was developed as an open-source project to create a compact, high-performance language model suitable for edge devices and research.
